item.title: Megabonk: Best Calcium Build Guide
item.description:
Megabonk has no shortage of memorable characters. From Megachad, whose use of Aura was featured in Megabonk trailers, to the obvious Dracula insert character Vlad, who wields Blood Magic, every character in the game has something unique to bring to the table. One of the most fun characters to play is Calcium, a skateboarding skeleton who can reach supersonic speeds.

Calcium's passive bonus increases his Movement Speed over time until he gets his and scales his Damage output with his Movement Speed – to make the best Calcium build, you'll have to push his Movement Speed stat to its absolute limits. Follow this guide to learn the best Calcium weapons to get first, the most useful Tomes for Calcium, and items you should prioritize to push the best Calcium build to its most gnarly heights.

This guide assumes that you have unlocked all four Weapon slots, all four Tome Slots, and most unlockable Items. Though it is still useful for Tiers 1 and 2, this best Calcium build guide is tuned for Tier 3 runs in Megabonk .

Best Calcium Weapons in Megabonk

Bone (Default)

  • Bone Effect : Throws bones that bounce off enemies

The Bone automatically hones in on enemies and ricochets to hit other nearby enemies (with no reduced damage) a certain number of times based on its level. It's a bit like the Revolver, but with less Projectile Speed and Crit Chance and higher base Damage and Bounces.

Try to upgrade this as you search for the other three best Calcium weapons in Megabonk – especially if an upgrade increases its Projectile Count.

Bananarang

  • Bananarang Effect : Throws bananas that return to the owner

The Bananarang is useful for Calcium because the weapon pairs surprisingly well with his fast Movement Speed. Though the Bananarang starts with a slow Projectile Speed, each projectile returns to Calcium after reaching its apex – even across vast distances.

Avoid taking damage to increase Movement Speed, then race past enemies as you fire Bananarangs out, zoom further ahead, then watch as each projectile hits every enemy behind you on its return arc.

Lightning Staff

  • Lightning Staff Effect : Summons lightning to smite nearby enemies

Because Calcium turns into such a fast character, you don't have to worry about only choosing weapons that attack enemies within the immediate vicinity. The Lightning Staff deals damage in an area to a random enemy "nearby", but it has a deceptively long range.

Go as fast as you can to max the Lightning Staff's damage, and get some Projectile Count upgrades, to see it zap away vast swathes of enemies and clear room for Calcium to more easily navigate.

Aegis

  • Aegis Effect : Blocks incoming attacks and sends out shockwaves

A very useful "weapon" for just about every character in Megabonk , the Aegis essentially provides a certain number of Shields that prevent damage upon hit. These Shields recharge over time, which occurs more rapidly if you increase Attack Speed.

As Calcium starts to reach supersonic speed levels, you will more than likely skate into a crowd of enemies by accident and risk getting hit before you're able to jump away. Pick up Aegis to retain your Movement Speed through these hits and get more time to get out of tricky situations.

Best Calcium Tomes in Megabonk

XP Tome/Cursed Tome/Luck Tome

  • XP Tome Effect : Increases how much XP you gain from every source
  • Cursed Tome : Increases Difficulty, increasing enemy spawns and stats
  • Luck Tome : Increases the Luck stat, improving your chance to get good items or upgrades

There are three Tomes in Megabonk that are far and away the most important Tomes to acquire and upgrade for just about every build: XP Tome, Cursed Tome, and Luck Tome. The XP tome boosts the value of XP shards, the Cursed Tome increases the number of enemies that spawn (thereby increasing the number of XP shards that can spawn), and Luck increases your chance to get higher-quality rewards.

Get these as early as you can to take advantage of their borderline broken scaling. For example, if you can get XP Tome early and upgrade it to around 50% in the first half of Tier 1, you'll likely reach level 35 or 40 before you have to face the first stage boss.

Damage Tome

  • Damage Tome Effect : Increases all outgoing Damage by a certain percentage

The Damage Tome offers a straightforward Damage bonus that applies to all of your outgoing sources of Damage. Because you should be able to survive reliably enough with high Movement Speed, pick up a Damage Tome instead of other survivability-oriented Tomes to boost your Bone, Bananarang, and Lightning Staff damage.

Agility Tome

  • Agility Tome Effect : Increases Movement Speed by a certain percentage

Calcium's passive ability boosts his outgoing Damage based on his Movement Speed, which also increases over time as you avoid taking damage. Because his Damage scales from his Movement Speed, increasing this stat with the Agility Tome translates directly to more offensive power. Just be careful not to accidentally fly into a crowd of enemies.

Quantity Tome

  • Quantity Tome Effect : Increases how many Projectiles weapons fire

The Quantity Tome is broadly useful in the Megabonk early game because it quickly increases the number of projectiles you can send out. But when you get some weapon upgrades, you will also naturally increase their Projectile count. The real reason this is so useful for Calcium is because it also increase the number of Shield projectiles generated by Aegis.

If you don't find a Damage or Agility Tome, the Quantity Tome is a reliable alternative to fill your fourth Tome slow (after XP, Cursed, and Luck).

Best Calcium Items in Megabonk

The best items for Calcium increase his Movement Speed and maneuverability, which comes in handy as he becomes uncontrollably fast (if left undamaged long enough). Keep an eye out for men in suits wearing different colored hats – these hats correspond to the rarity of items they sell in exchange for Gold.

Each of these vendors offers a selection of three items, increasing in cost based on rarity and Tier. Most of your items will come as random rewards from opened Chests. However, if you find one of these hat-wearing men, keep an eye out for these best Sir Oofie items to give a huge boost to the build:

  • Common Items
    • Turbo Socks : Increase Movement Speed by +15%
    • Time Bracelet : +8% XP Gain. Definitely not just a normal watch.
    • Forbidden Juice : Increase Crit Chance by +10%
    • Battery : Increase Attack Speed by +8%
    • Clover : Increase Luck by +7.5%
    • Skuleg : Increase Difficulty by +7%

  • Rare Items
    • Feathers : Jump Higher and Further
    • Coward's Cloak : Boost Movement Speed upon taking damage. Also gain +5% Movement Speed
    • Backpack : +1 Projectile Count for all Weapons
    • Golden Sneakers : Earn money by moving around
    • Unstable Transfusion : +27% chance to apply a stack of Bloodmark when hitting an enemy.

  • Epic Items
    • Turbo Skates : The faster you move, the more Attack Speed you gain. Max 40% per stack
    • Scarf : Deal 33% more Damage while airborne
    • Slurp Gloves : Cast blood magic upon hitting an enemy, damaging nearby enemies and healing you for 7.5%. 9s cooldown
    • Demonic Soul : Increase Damage by 0.1% per kill (max 100%)

  • Legendary Items
    • Big Bonk : 2% chance to BONK an enemy, dealing 20x damage
    • Speed Boi : Upon taking damage below 50% Max HP, slow down time and deal 2x damage.
    • Sucky Magnet : Periodically drag in all XP around you.

item.title: Megabonk: Best Sir Oofie Build Guide
item.description:
One of the first two characters you can pick in Megabonk is Sir Oofie. While Fox moves relatively fast and starts with the long-range Fire Staff, Sir Oofie is slower and starts with the close-range Sword, making him more synergistic with weapons, Tomes, and items that take advantage of his melee strengths.

While your Weapons, Tomes, and Items are randomized in each run of Megabonk , you can use Rerolls, Skips, and Banishes to force certain rewards over others. Follow this guide to the best Sir Oofie build in Megabonk to learn which weapons you should prioritize, the best Sir Oofie Tomes to pick up, and items you should try to acquire over the course of your run.

This guide assumes that you have unlocked all four Weapon slots, all four Tome Slots, and most unlockable Items. Though it is still useful for Tiers 1 and 2, this best Sir Oofie build guide is tuned for Tier 3 runs in Megabonk .

Best Sir Oofie Weapons

Sword (Default)

  • Sword Effect : Slashes through multiple enemies

Sir Oofie starts with the Sword, which can be upgraded to slash rapidly through a huge swathe of enemies in the direction he is facing. However, because Sir Oofie has a very slow movement speed, you need to combine this with other weapons that are effective against close-range enemies.

Aegis

  • Aegis Effect : Blocks incoming attacks and sends out shockwaves

The Aegis provides a single block for each spawned shield projectile which recharges over time. This is useful because Sir Oofie can have trouble keeping enemies away from melee range, and you will more than likely take a few hits on the way to Tier 3. Aegis is practically required to survive to Tier 3 across all characters, but is especially useful for Sir Oofie.

Dexecutioner

  • Dexecutioner Effect : A piercing blade. Small chance to instantly execute an enemy.

The Dexecutioner takes a long time to unlock, but it's well worth the grind. This weapon doesn't deal as much damage as the Sword, but it has a chance to instantly kill any non-boss enemy. With a rapid attack speed, you'll clear waves of enemies incredibly quickly, as you gain more chances to proc this weapon's unique execution effect.

Aura

  • Aura Effect : Damages enemies in an area around you

Because Sir Oofie is slow, enemies tend to be able to get within close range as he is unable to outpace them until he picks up some Agility Tome upgrades. Turn this weakness into a strength by picking up Aura. This scales with Attack Speed to damage enemies more rapidly while they are within the radius.

If you take Aura, be sure to pick up some Size upgrades from Charge Shrines (or in place of another recommended Sir Oofie tome below).

Best Sir Oofie Tomes

XP Tome/Cursed Tome/Luck Tome

  • XP Tome Effect : Increases how much XP you gain from every source
  • Cursed Tome : Increases Difficulty, increasing enemy spawns and stats
  • Luck Tome : Increases the Luck stat, improving your chance to get good items or upgrades

XP Tome, Cursed Tome, and Luck Tome are all powerful because of how well they scale through a full run. Get the XP and the Cursed tome early, and you'll level faster because you will spawn more enemies with higher scaling for each XP shard collected – and with higher Luck, your level-up and other rewards will be better throughout your entire run.

As long as you don't need upgrades for survivability, your main priority should be to upgrade these three tomes. Aim to get each to around level 10 or higher to have a significant impact on your leveling speed and reward quality.

Cooldown Tome

  • Cooldown Tome Effect : Increases Attack Speed for all weapons (increases the number of damage ticks per second for Aura)

The Cooldown Tome has a major effect on all four of the best Sir Oofie weapons. It reduces the time between Sword slashes, increases the rate your Aegis shields recharge, grants more chances to proc the Dexecutioner effect, and triggers damage from the Aura more rapidly while enemies are within its range.

Agility Tome

  • Agility Tome Effect : Increases Movement Speed by a certain percentage

Sir Oofie is one of the slowest characters in Megabonk . Because movement and maneuverability are such important stats in Megabonk , it's not a bad idea to pick up an Agility Tome for your fourth slot.

Quantity Tome

  • Quantity Tome Effect : Increases how many Projectiles weapons fire

Quantity is an effect that is extremely powerful in the early game and not as noticeable in the late game. Notably, Quantity does not affect Aura at all. This is still a good Tome to pick up for Sir Oofie, though, because it gives you more Shields for the Aegis, which can save your run in a pinch. The extra Sword and Dexecutioner hits are nice at the start of your run, but not as impactful later on.

Best Sir Oofie Items

The best items for Sir Oofie increase his survivability, damage, and take advantage of his passive Armor boost with each level. Keep an eye out for men in suits wearing different colored hats – these hats indicate the rarity of the items they will sell, increasing in cost based on rarity and current Tier. Each of these vendors offers a selection of three items.

Most of your items will come as random rewards from opened Chests. However, if you find one of these hat-wearing men, keep an eye out for these best Sir Oofie items to give a huge boost to the build:

  • Common Items
    • Moldy Cheese : +40% chance to poison enemies on hit. Moly Cheese my beloved
    • Ice Crystal : 7.5% chance to freeze enemies upon hitting them
    • Time Bracelet : +8% XP Gain. Definitely not just a normal watch.
    • Forbidden Juice : Increase Crit Chance by +10%
    • Battery : Increase Attack Speed by +8%
    • Clover : Increase Luck by +7.5%
    • Skuleg : Increase Difficulty by +7%

  • Rare Items
    • Unstable Transfusion : +27% chance to apply a stack of Bloodmark when hitting an enemy.
    • Beer : +20% damage at the cost of -5% Max HP
    • Brass Knuckles : Deal +20% more damage to nearby enemies
    • Thunder Mitts : Upon hitting an enemy, clap their cheeks so hard it generates a lightning strike. 10s cooldown.

  • Epic Items
    • Spiky Shield : Gain +2 Thorns for every 1% Armor. Also gain 10% Armor.
    • Mirror : Reflect any incoming damage back to the attacker, and gain a short invulnerability
    • Demonic Soul : Increase Damage by 0.1% per kill (max 100%)
    • Quin's Mask : Thorns damage has a 50% chance to explode and damage nearby enemies

    • Big Bonk : 2% chance to BONK an enemy, dealing 20x damage
    • Ice Cube : 20% chance to inflict ice damage when hitting enemies. Ice can now freeze enemies.
    • Overpowered Lamp : +1 chance to proc on-hit effects

item.title: Helldivers 2: Is the Meridian Singularity Reopening a Sad History Lesson or a Dire Omen?
item.description:
Between Helldivers 2 and its predecessor, there is a staggering amount of worldbuilding that players may have FOMO toward if they happen to neglect a certain in-game event. Indeed, for valiant Helldivers who’ve been around long enough to remember when Meridia became a Terminid Supercolony and was subsequently collapsed into a Singularity (believed to be a black hole, but later discerned as a wormhole) via Dark Fluid, the Meridian Singularity stands erected as an ominous purple portal with a rich history in Helldivers 2 lore.

Moreover, it wasn’t that long ago that Helldivers 2 received a big batch of recruits, thanks to a momentous launch on Xbox. Unless these new players had been keeping up to date with a game they were excited to play by the end of August, such narrative updates will ultimately be distant information they’re unattached to, as if they were sifting through a social studies textbook to read about tumultuous and formative events without having experienced them themselves. Therefore, there may be a terrible mixture of curiosity and anxiety concerning what may come of the Meridian Singularity’s sudden reopening to the public.

Helldivers 2’s Meridian Singularity is a Squid Omen That We Can’t Dismiss

Despite it having been inaccessible for a while, the Meridian ‘Black Hole’ now rests among the rubble of the Celeste Sector’s fractured Ivis and Moradesh planets as a bizarre spectacle that you can view from the deck of the Destroyer, and any new players who are unfamiliar with this lengthy and tragic ordeal may also be unaware that Pilen V, New Haven, Widow’s Harbor, and Super Earth’s neighbor, Mars, had been razed by Helldivers 2 ’s Illuminate faction as it beelined toward democracy’s greatest bastion. As Meridia’s planet description reads:

Meridian Black Hole

“The prosperous Meridian was corrupted into a Terminid Supercolony, necessitating its destruction using the mysterious Dark Fluid. This galactic scar is all that remains.”

The Galactic War table regales players with intriguing tales between each enemy faction’s infested corners, but Helldivers 2 ’s Meridian Singularity is easily the most paramount piece of lore that Helldivers 2 has had in a while.

So, the fact that it remains and is viewable again as a ‘planet’ players can travel to, but not dive into any missions on, is neat, as new players can bask in the Meridian Singularity’s purple glow and ask questions to their fellow Helldivers about what occurred there. Of course, anyone who understands the severity of the Meridian Singularity will also acknowledge how remarkably thrilling and potentially troubling it is that Arrowhead is bringing it back into the limelight:

Meridia Re-Opened for Observation

“The Meridian Singularity has been re-opened for patriotic observation.

All Helldivers are authorized to visit the former planet to contemplate the immense loss inflicted upon our society by the enemies of Freedom, and the imperative for merciless Justice thereby implied.”

Helldivers 2’s Leaked Illuminate Units May Be Here Sooner Than Later

If the Meridian Singularity being reopened is meant to not only educate newer players but also tease the next squid onslaught, it unfortunately wouldn’t be wholly surprising. The Illuminate still has a ton of legroom to explore new content as an enemy faction, for instance, and Helldivers 2 leaks are saturated with Illuminate units that could arrive whenever Arrowhead wishes to embolden the squids, assuming the leaks are legitimate and/or ever officially confirmed as content that will be added in the foreseeable future.

In the meantime, Arrowhead has a lot on its plate with substantial performance issues it hopes to combat. I’ll be alarmed if Helldivers 2 ’s Automaton faction doesn’t receive an overdue update first, though, with the Meridian Singularity menacingly lying in wait as a perpetual reminder of what Super Earth has endured.

item.title: How to Get Imaginary Friends in The Sims 4
item.description:
In recent years, The Sims 4 has added quite a bit of gameplay for child Sims, and it's truly made Sims' childhoods feel meaningful and like they impact their lives in the future. The Adventure Awaits expansion pack introduced imaginary friends to The Sims 4 , and it will only accentuate this. Each Sim can have its own friend, and they will help shape them and accompany them through the journey that is childhood.

However, first players will need to know how they can get their Sims an imaginary friend in The Sims 4 , and from then on, they can decide if they want to turn them into real Sims or keep them exclusive to this early stage of life. This guide will show players how their Sims can grow up with an imaginary friend beside them.

How to Get an Imaginary Friend in The Sims 4

To get an imaginary friend in The Sims 4 , players have to enter Build Mode and purchase one of the four available ImagineMe! dolls in the Kids > Toys section . Alternatively, they can type Imaginary Friend in the search bar and the options will also appear. Players must place the toy in the Sims' home, but this won't be enough to make an imaginary friend. The Sims has to meet one of these requirements in order to turn the doll into an imaginary friend:

  • Befriend the doll
  • Achieve Level 3 in the Creative Skill
  • Have an extreme low Social Need

If the Sim meets one of these requirements, they can turn the doll into an imaginary friend by taking them out of their inventory and selecting the Turn Into Imaginary Friend option.

  • Sims can play and hang out with their imaginary friends, but if they're controlling another Sim it will appear as if the child is playing with or talking to themselves.

    Eventually, the friend will return to Imaginary Land, but Sims can bring them back at any time by placing them in the world and selecting the Summon Imaginary Friend interaction.

How to Keep an Imaginary Friend Forever

Imaginary friends are a great way to boost a lonely child Sim's Social Need, but as they grow older, Sims tend to focus on other things in life and tend to forget about these friends. However, that doesn't have to be the case; players can actually get their Sims' imaginary friends to stay in the picture forever by turning them into real Sims.

When a child Sim turns into a teenager, they will be able to interact with their imaginary friend doll and choose the Offer to Make Real option , which will turn them into a real Sim and add them to their household (or Manage Households if the current household is full). When Sims turn an imaginary friend into a real Sim, they will receive the Non-Fictitous Friend sentiment towards their former doll.

How to Get Rid of Imaginary Friends in The Sims 4

What Happens When You Say Goodbye Forever to An Imaginary Friend in The Sims 4

Players can get rid of their imaginary friends for good as well. This can be done as a child or as an older Sim. To get rid of an imaginary friend in The Sims 4 , players must interact with them and select the Say Goodbye Forever interaction. If they're in their doll-form, they will have to select this option once again to confirm it. Then, the two will hug and share an endearing moment.

When Sims say goodbye forever to an imaginary friend, they will remain in their Relationship panel. While the friend does not make the Sim feel guilty at the moment of goodbye, it is still an inevitability. The Sim will receive the Fictitous Friend No More guilty sentiment towards their doll. However, if they keep the doll around, they can use the Seek Comfort from an Old Friend interaction whenever they experience negative moodlets.

item.title: Ghost of Yotei: All Bamboo Strike Locations
item.description:
Players can find 15 Bamboo Strikes in Ghost of Yotei , and each of them will help to increase their total Spirit, allowing them to heal in battle and use powerful attack moves. Spirit is essential to staying in the fight, making it important for Atsu's vengeance as she fights and kills her way through Ezo to get to the Yotei Six. If players want to find all 15 Bamboo Strike locations in Ghost of Yotei to increase Atsu's Spirit, then we've got you covered right here.

All Yotei Grasslands Bamboo Strike Locations in Ghost of Yotei

1 – Father’s Bamboo Strike

This is the first Bamboo Strike you can find in the Yotei Grasslands, and it's available directly at your Home. You can find the Bamboo Strike on the north-west ledge of the cliff. Simply interact with the destroyed stand to repair it and test your blade against it.

2 – Nupur River Bamboo Strike

Head upstream of the Nupur River until you reach near the Maw of the Serpent. From here, take a sharp left and head west, where just above the Crow's Nest Watchtower, is this Bamboo Strike location. You'll need to speak with the NPC here to get him to move out of the way.

3 – Mountain Trail Bamboo Strike

The Mountain Trail Bamboo Strike is automatically achieved during "The Way of the Dual Katana", a Main Tale that unlocks once you enter Ezo for the first time. Simply head west of the Yotei Grasslands to enter the Mountain Trail, where you will meet an old master. This Bamboo Strike has a gimmick that only uses the left side of the controller, so it can be a tad trickier than most.

4 – Yotei River Bamboo Strike

Head north of the Yotei River, just above the "Y" on the map, to locate this Bamboo Strike, which is on a hill among the white trees, where foxes and a bear cub will watch you master your abilities. Don't worry, there's no mama bear that will come and eat Atsu like salmon for messing this challenge up.

All Ishikari Plain Bamboo Strike Locations in Ghost of Yotei

5 – Matsumae Encampment Bamboo Strike

Once you reach the Matsumae Encampment with the Jubei during "The Oni" Main Tale, you will come across a Matsumae Samurai who challenges you to show your power through the Bamboo Strike. Beating this Bamboo Strike also rewards you with a fancy new hat, and an opportunity to embarrass Jubei in front of his Matsumae colleagues.

6 – Urara Bamboo Strike

Head east of Ishikari Fork into the Urara Forest, where you will find the Oni's Breath Inn. To the right of the Oni's Breath Inn is a Bamboo Strike activity, and completing it rewards you with a broken demon mask, which is deserved after the heckling from the onlookers.

7 – Rumoi Bamboo Strike

Further north of the Ishikari Plain, you will reach the Rumoi River. Just above and between the "O" and "I" on the map, is the Bamboo Strike on a hill. You'll find a settler here that you will have to move out of the way, but that's easily achieved by either bribing him for 200 coins or sparing him. Don't worry, it's a friendly spar, so you won't be gaining a new enemy.

All Tokachi Range Bamboo Strike Locations in Ghost of Yotei

8 – Huranui’s Rest Inn Bamboo Strike

Head to Huranui's Rest Inn to find this Bamboo Strike. In order to actually start the Bamboo Strike, you must consume 2 bottles of Sake, which is achieved by holding Down on the D-Pad. In your drunken state, you can now complete the Bamboo Strike. There are Sake bottles here for you to drink, or you can purchase them from merchants.

9 – Misty Valley Bamboo Strike

The Misty Valley Bamboo Strike is found in the south region of the Tokachi Range, past Shizunai Woods into the Abandoned Tominaga Estate. This Bamboo Strike only becomes available once you have started or completed "The Spider Lily General" Mythic Tale, so simply approach the Mysterious Gate in the south of Shizaunai Woods. Then, venture to the left to find a maze. Complete the maze by following the paths 3 times with the spider lilies (red flowers), and the Bamboo Strike will appear.

10 – Niikappu’s Fork Bamboo Strike

Head northeast of Huranui's Rest Inn and venture south of Twin Ponds of Hidaka to find this Bamboo Strike. It's on a hill with some other settlers, but be warned, as you approach it will see two violent bears, so be ready to bloody your blade before doing this challenge.

All Teshio Ridge Bamboo Strike Locations in Ghost of Yotei

11 – Sakuru Bamboo Strike

In the snowy north region of Teshio Ridge, you will find this Bamboo Strike. It's north of Sakuru Woods and up a mountain, marked with snow and some altars, so simply follow the golden bird to its destination to reach this Bamboo Strike.

12 – Hakodake Bamboo Strike

To the east of the Hakodake Mountains, you'll be able to find this Bamboo Strike up the mountain. Despite the cold region, the frost will not damage Atsu as it will further up north. This Bamboo Strike is by a lone hut on the cliff, and completing it will see a fortune teller appear, and if you pay her 200 Coins, she will read your fortune and provide you with a new side mission.

13 – Sarobetsu Bamboo Strike

Head to Sarobetsu Lake in the north-west region, which is an Inn surrounded by an ice lake. From the Inn, head northeast and you'll find this Bamboo Strike nearby, marked next to a large rock.

All Oshima Coast Bamboo Strike Locations in Ghost of Yotei

14 – Atago Bamboo Strike

Just above the Atago Rice Fields, you can find this Bamboo Strike. However, you'll need to pick up and throw the spears and swords in the area. You can do this by holding R2 and pressing Square, as trying to start the Bamboo Strike before throwing away these weapons will see you hit by lightning every time.

15 – Matsumae Bamboo Strike

In the southern area of Oshima Coast, past the Atago Rice Fields, you can enter Castle Matsumae's village area. To the right of this village and past the blossom tree path in a courtyard, is this Bamboo Strike activity. This Bamboo Strike also requires you to use your left hand, so prepare to use the left side of your controller.
